intro: Randia sericantha, commonly known as the red root or redstem randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its fruits are capsules that contain numerous small seeds. Randia sericantha is often found in moist, wooded areas and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
